com.foreach.across.modules.filemanager.services

Interface FileManager

  • All Superinterfaces:
    FileRepository
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    FileManagerImpl

    public interface FileManager
extends FileRepository
    Central interface providing access to the underlying file repositories. A single FileRepository can have any type of implementation (local storage, remote storage, database backed).

    This interface also implements the FileRepository and will considered repository methods to run either against the default file repository or (in case of using a FileDescriptor) against the repository specified in the FileDescriptor.

    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Arne Vandamme
    See Also:
    FileManagerImpl

        FileRepository getRepository(@NonNull

        Returns the FileRepository to use for the given repositoryId.

        Returns:
        FileRepository instance or null if none registered.

      • createFile

        @Deprecated
FileDescriptor createFile(String repositoryId)
        Deprecated. since 1.4.0 - use createFileResource(String) instead
        Create a new file in the repository. This allocates the file instance, but the content of the file is empty. What exactly empty means depends on the implementation of the repository.
        Parameters:
        repositoryId - Id of the file repository.
        Returns:
        FileDescriptor instance.

      • moveInto

        @Deprecated
FileDescriptor moveInto(String repositoryId,
                                    File file)
        Deprecated. since 1.4.0 - use createFileResource(String) instead
        Moves a File into the repository, once the file is fully available in the repository an attempt will be made to delete the original file.

        No exception will be thrown if the delete fails as the new instance will be available in the repository already and this is considered the important part of the transaction.

        Parameters:
        repositoryId - Id of the file repository.
        file - File instance to move into the repository.
        Returns:
        FileDescriptor instance.

      • save

        @Deprecated
FileDescriptor save(String repositoryId,
                                File file)
        Deprecated. since 1.4.0 - use createFileResource(String) instead
        Stores a file in the repository, but leaves the original file alone. If you want to move a temporary file to the repository and delete it immediately when done, use FileRepository.moveInto(java.io.File) instead.
        Parameters:
        repositoryId - Id of the file repository.
        file - File instance to save in the repository.
        Returns:
        FileDescriptor instance.

      • save

        @Deprecated
FileDescriptor save(String repositoryId,
                                InputStream inputStream)
        Deprecated. since 1.4.0 - use createFileResource(String) instead
        Stores an InputStream as a new file in the repository.
        Parameters:
        repositoryId - Id of the file repository.
        inputStream - InputStream of the file content.
        Returns:
        FileDescriptor instance.

      • createTempFile

        File createTempFile()
        Quick creates a physical file in the temporary FileRepository. The file returned can safely be used for writing to and can afterwards be moved into a specific file resource.
        Returns:
        A File instance to be used.
